story:
Here's a bedtime story for your little one:

In the land of Indonesia, where the sun dips into the sea and paints the sky with hues of crimson and gold, there was a magical kingdom hidden deep in the heart of the jungle.

In this kingdom, there lived a brave and kind-hearted prince named Raja Adi. He was the son of the wise and just King and Queen of the land, and he loved nothing more than exploring the jungle and playing with the creatures that lived there.

One day, as Raja Adi wandered deeper into the jungle than he had ever gone before, he stumbled upon a hidden clearing. In the center of the clearing stood an enormous tree, its trunk twisted and gnarled with age. The tree was covered in vines and flowers, and a soft, golden light emanated from within its heart.

As Raja Adi approached the tree, a gentle voice whispered his name. "Raja Adi, come closer, brave prince." It was the spirit of the tree, who introduced himself as Raja Kemala, the Guardian of the Jungle.

Raja Kemala told Raja Adi that he had been chosen to receive a special gift from the ancient tree. The gift was a magical amulet, which would allow him to communicate with all the creatures of the jungle, and to understand their secrets and stories.

Raja Adi was thrilled with the gift, and he spent many days learning about the jungle and its inhabitants. He heard the stories of the wise old owls, who could see into the future; the mischievous monkeys, who loved to play tricks on each other; and the gentle elephants, who roamed the land with wise and gentle footsteps.

As the days passed, Raja Adi became known throughout the jungle as the prince who understood the language of the animals. And when the jungle was threatened by a great drought, Raja Adi used his newfound powers to bring the creatures together and find a solution to the problem.

The animals of the jungle worked together, using their unique skills to gather water and bring life back to the parched land. And Raja Adi, with the help of Raja Kemala, led the way, guiding and inspiring the others with his bravery and kindness.

As the jungle flourished once more, Raja Adi returned to his kingdom, where he was greeted as a hero. His parents, the King and Queen, were proud of their son's bravery and compassion, and they knew that he would one day rule the kingdom with wisdom and justice.

And so, every night, the creatures of the jungle would gather around the great tree, and Raja Adi would tell them stories of his adventures and the lessons he had learned. The night sky would twinkle with stars, and the jungle would fill with the sweet scent of blooming flowers, as the animals would listen in awe to the brave prince's tales.

And now, my dear son, it is time for you to go to bed, but remember, you too have the power to make a difference in the world. Always be brave, kind, and compassionate, just like Raja Adi, and you will make Indonesia proud.

Goodnight, sleep tight, and may the spirit of Raja Kemala watch over you.
